video.title: GENE MUTATION MAY HELP EXPLAIN DIFFERENCE IN LUNG FUNCTION AMONG CYSTIC FIBROSIS PATIENTS
video.description: Approximately thirty thousand people in the United States have cystic fibrosis, a life-threatening disease that often leads to lung damage.  The severity of the disease can vary greatly between patients.  Some die young while others make it into adulthood.  New research suggests a gene mutation may be one reason why some cystic fibrosis patients do worse than others.
